elements.title: Joseph Bosworth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joseph Bosworth (pictured) was the last Republican speaker of the Kentucky House of Representatives until the election of Jeff Hoover in 2017?

elements.title: Schönhardt polyhedron (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Latvian-Soviet artist Karlis Johansons exhibited a skeletal tensegrity form of the Schönhardt polyhedron seven years before Erich Schönhardt's 1928 paper on its mathematics?

elements.title: Walker Keith Baylor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Walker Keith Baylor, a strong believer in phrenology and physiognomy, determined the fitness of political candidates by measuring their faces and heads with a tape measure?

elements.title: Bellingham fishermen's memorial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that names have been steadily added to a Bellingham fishermen's memorial as local fishermen are lost at sea?

elements.title: Adrian Ward-Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Diana, Princess of Wales, drove through the night to be with Adrian Ward-Jackson before he died?

elements.title: outcome switching (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in nearly one in three clinical trials, authors engage in outcome switching, which can undermine the reliability of the trials?

elements.title: Lewes Friends Meeting House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lewes Friends Meeting House, built in 1784, replaced an earlier building whose proximity to a slaughterhouse made it "unfit to sit in"?

elements.title: Beck–Fahrner syndrome (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that only approximately 50 individuals have been diagnosed with Beck–Fahrner syndrome?

elements.title: runology (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "runology" is the study of how to run away from China?
